intro: Catalepis gracilis, commonly known as the slender catalepis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for xeriscaping and rock gardens.
